name: Food In Indian Literature - Monthly Book Club
description:
Our emotions and memories are intrinsically related to the food we eat and the genre of food literature combines them in a way that helps us connect not only to our past and our present, to different cultures, and communities, values and rituals, events both life-changing and mundane but to each other as well.
So, if viewing the world through the lens of food and literature interests you, then join us to begin a dialogue on “Food in Indian Literature” and to celebrate those stories and their diversity. Each month with Prachi Grover, we will be reading our way through several powerful (and delicious) narratives.
June Read: Following Fish by Samanth Subramanian
We assure you that you will enjoy every single bite!
The session is free but registration is a must as we have limited spots available.
Prachi Grover is a culinary consultant and educator and is the founder of “From Words to Wok”; a community for people who to love to read and eat!

name: Dum Dama Dum - Children's Theatre and Reading Festival
description:
The Theatre and Reading festival Dum Dama Dum by Atta Galatta that began in 2017 unites two beautiful things in a child’s life, the love for drama and love for reading. The festival will have plays for children and families from various renowned theatre groups while on another level they can enter into a world of books from their favourite authors and publishers.
The Day Pass includes access to all scheduled plays. Final lineup TBA
Adults and children require tickets.

name: Tales of Tenali Rama - Theatre Performance for Kids
description: Tenali Rama and his tales are an evergreen part of everyone’s childhood. Growing with the stories of Tenali Rama and his ‘adventures’ in the court of Krishna Deva Raya kept children and adults rolling with laughter. BLT brings these beloved stories alive through a unique two people StoryActing format. Come, laugh with us!

name: Just for Laughs - Children’s Interactive Theatre Performance
description:
"Just for laughs" is a collection of gags/ short acts that include a variety of funny stories composed with the audience present.  Each gag is based on a different act and is around 5-10 minutes long. There will laughter tricks, a lot of physicality that will make the kids go awed.
Cast: Prithesh, Siddharth, Sumayya, Aiena, Darshan.

name: The Bougainvillea Circle - Connection Circle
description:
"Sawubona" a Zulu Greeting meaning, "We See You". At Bougainvillea Circles you are offered a space to be heard, seen, welcomed as you are. A non-judgmental, safe, trusted space where you are free to be all that you want to be. Nothing More, Nothing less. No Restrictions, no judgements, just an intimate group of people looking for a space to be real. A space where we`re all less alone for a little while. Where we are seen, how we want to be seen. Conversations, Connections, Community of Compassion. All that makes the world go round, after Love of course!
Remember - Sawubona: We See You.

name: The Monster Who Could Not Climb A Tree - Puppet Show
description: This performance delves into the emotions of a 9-year-old boy, Avi. He has issues with anger, which only becomes worse when he learns that his parents have adopted a 3-year-old girl Neha. He has personified his anger as a Monster. He later learns that he can escape his Monster by climbing a tree. He feels emotions at a high intensity, but he is not sure how to deal with them. He is still exploring his emotions, while adapting to new changes. Although climbing a tree is not the ultimate solution for his issues. How does Avi learn to deal with his Monster? Does the Monster ever go away?

name: It’s Not You, It’s Me – Spilling the Situationship Tea - Theatre Performance
description:
Get ready for an evening that’s equal parts laughter, nostalgia, and heart!
Join us as we unpack the beautiful mess of situationships, heartbreaks, and modern-day romance, all inspired by true stories from our actors’ lives. From ghosting to grand gestures, dating apps to old-school love letters — this performance is a rollercoaster through the ages of love.
Whether you're a hopeless romantic or just romantically hopeless, this show has something for everyone.
Date: 21st June (Saturday)
Time: 6:30 PM to 7:30 PM
Venue: Atta Galatta, Indiranagar
Come fall in (and out of) love with us — one story at a time. ❤
Seats are limited – don’t miss it!

name: Love Stories from Indian Heritage - A Late Evening Story Time for Adults
description:
Love stories aren’t only about the hero and heroine for love can rarely exist in isolation. Zealous messengers, art and music as mood enhancers, food as aphrodisiacs, taboos and mores – all play a pivotal role in shaping stories of love. Vikram Sridhar and Aparna Jaishankar rummage through the passages of time to bring you various hues of love etched in our heritage through literature, architecture, songs and poetry through the all- encompassing art form of oral storytelling.
About Aparna Jaishankar
Aparna Jaishankar is a Storyteller with a penchant for Indic mythology. She believes that there is no ONE version of any story. Her storytelling performances take a contemporary view of ancient tales. Aparna also works with educators in developing learning perspectives in the classroom and with organisations in building internal narratives.
About Vikram Sridhar 
Vikram Sridhar is a Performance Storyteller and theatre practitioner who believes in Storytelling as a strong medium for Conservation and Conversation, which is highly relevant in the modern context. Vikram combines his work and interest in Theatre, Social Work, and Conservation in his Storytelling and has performed for audience of various age groups across India.

name: Storywalk Through Indiranagar - Story Walk
description: On a Sunday morning, walk through the lanes of INDIRA NAGAR with Vikram Sridhar discovering the lanes through the Folklore, Heritage and Ecology of the area. The walk will begin and culminate at ATTA GALATTA. The tales will revolve around historical, mythical and personal narratives weaved as we discover the area through the walk.

name: Meet and Reparent - Wellness Workshop
description:
✨ For the part of you that still longs to be seen, heard, and loved... ✨
Join us for a gentle, 2-hour journey to reconnect with your inner child — the tender, playful, and wise part of you that still lives within
In this guided workshop, we will:
🫂 Explore the concept of the inner child & reparenting
🌿 Create a safe space for reflection and healing
🌀 Engage in guided practices to connect with your inner child
🎨 Use art to integrate your experience
No prior experience needed — just an open heart and curiosity. This is your space to soften, slow down, and come home to yourself💜
📅 22nd June (Sunday)
🕚 11 AM – 1 PM
📍 Atta Galatta, Bangalore
Aanchal Sharma is a psychotherapist with over three years of experience supporting young adults and adults in navigating life’s challenges.
She holds an MSc in Psychology from Queen Mary University of London, along with certifications in Hypnotherapy, Neurolinguistic Programming (NLP), and Timeline Therapy. She is also well-trained in Emotional Freedom Technique (EFT) and Inner Child Work.
Co facilitator Jade (they/them),
Artist and community support spaces/meetup facilitator

name: Chittara Folk Art Workshop for Kids - Folk Art Workshop
description:
Come and learn about Karnataka’s own ancient art form, Chittara! Done on walls of houses for different celebrations, Chittara paintings are a source of great joy, beauty and creativity. For painting, women artists use eco-friendly natural resources like ground rice paste for white, charred rice for black, powdered Gurige seeds for yellow, and soil/earth for red.
Kids, come join this workshop where you will learn to draw some cool Chittara designs and where they came from - like the Patanga or butterfly, and Poppali! We will show you natural colours, and tell you stories about how Chittara artists used them many years ago! You will also get to see and feel beautiful products made with ecofriendly grasses from our state. The most fun part - paint your own cane tray using all the designs you learn in the workshop, and take it home with you!
What will you take home?
Stories of Chittara art and natural colours!
Your own original Chittara artwork!
What do you need to bring?
Water bottle to keep you hydrated.
A tiny note book/notepad, a pencil, an eraser and a rag cloth.
Note: Other essential materials will be provided by us!
About CFRIA
Center for Revival of Indigenous Art (CFRIA), founded by Ms Geetha Bhat, is a non-profit organisation working to preserve and promote Chittara folk art, Karnataka. CFRIA has showcased events, Lec-dems, workshops at various educational, cultural institutions, and exhibitions. Chittara murals can be witnessed at Indira Gandhi National Centre for Arts (IGNCA) Indian Music Experience (IME) Bosch, Taneira showrooms to name a few. CFRIA is now working on the Chittara folk art Archival book, which aims to address the dearth of resources on Chittara, essential for its preservation. This book will capture Deevaru’s lifestyle, culture, challenges and way forward, aimed at a wide range of audiences internationally.
performer: Center for Revival of Indigenous Art

name: Learn Tarot in One Hour - Workshop
description:
Join us for a transformative and interactive Tarot workshop led by Anuradha Shukla, author of the book The Intuitive Edge: A DIY Tarot Guide for Smarter Decisions in Love and Business.
In this power-packed one-hour session, you'll unlock the basics of Tarot, learn to connect with your inner wisdom, and even perform your first self-reading—no prior experience needed!
Whether you're navigating love, work, or life changes, this session will empower you with a tool that blends mindfulness, symbolism, and intuition. Expect meaningful insights, hands-on card reading, and a fresh perspective on decision-making.
What You’ll Experience:

A quick yet powerful introduction to the Tarot deck
Learn how to do a 3-card reading
Decode symbols and trust your intuition
Get a Tarot cheat sheet

Limited seats. Reserve yours now and take the first step on your intuitive journey.

name: Chittara Folk Art Workshop for Adults - Folk Art Workshop
description:
The Chittara art form practised by the Deevaru Community is engaged primarily by the women folk of the community as a socio-cultural practice. Nestled in the ranges of verdant western ghats of North Canara live the Deevaru people, a matriarchal-agrarian community of nature-worshippers, residing in and around Sagara, Karnataka. Chittara art has become an integral part of their daily routines. It was never a profession, but a practice that has artistic and socio-cultural value. For women of the Deevaru community Chittara paintings are a source of great joy, beauty and creativity. For painting, women artists use eco-friendly natural resources like ground rice paste for white, charred rice for black, powdered Gurige seeds for yellow, and soil/earth for red.
In this workshop, you will learn to draw a few motifs of Chittara along with their description. You can then draw these on a small cane tray to take home to. You will also get to know how natural paints are used in this art along with the eco-friendly handicrafts they make.
What will you take home?
Knowing the socio-cultural aspects of the community
Learn a folk-art form of Karnataka
Completed piece of artwork done by yourself
What do you need to bring?
Water bottle to keep you hydrated.
Kindly get a note book/notepad, a pencil, an eraser and a rag cloth.
Note: Other essential materials will be provided by the host.
About CFRIA
Center for Revival of Indigenous Art (CFRIA), founded by Ms Geetha Bhat, is a non-profit organisation working to preserve and promote Chittara folk art, Karnataka. CFRIA has showcased events, Lec-dems, workshops at various educational, cultural institutions, and exhibitions. Chittara murals can be witnessed at Indira Gandhi National Centre for Arts (IGNCA) Indian Music Experience (IME) Bosch, Taneira showrooms to name a few. CFRIA is now working on the Chittara folk art Archival book, which aims to address the dearth of resources on Chittara, essential for its preservation. This book will capture Deevaru’s lifestyle, culture, challenges and way forward, aimed at a wide range of audiences internationally.
performer: Center for Revival of Indigenous Art

name: Read A Kitaab - Monthly Book Club
description:
📚✨ Bangalore, we’re back! ✨📚
Join the Read A Kitaab community for our June Meetup. Let’s talk books, swap stories, and dive into the question we love asking — What are you reading? 💬
🗓️ Date: Sunday, 22nd June
⏰ Time: 4 PM to 6 PM
📍 Venue: Atta Galatta, Indira Nagar
🎟️ Entry is FREE but registration is a must!
💬 DM us or ping on WhatsApp at 9082076420 to save your spot.
Bring your current reads, your bookish banter, and your coffee-loving selves! ☕📖

name: Queer Films & Feels - An Arts-Based Therapeutic Exploration of Queer Cinema
description:
2 films, 2 therapists and 1 wholesome evening of queer conversations.

Join us in watching Desi Queer Films together:
🗓️: 22nd June (Sunday)
⏰: 4:00-5:30PM
📍: Atta Galatta, Indiranagar
We are bringing two Kashish film festival nominations to Bangalore. Let’s come together to witness the work of Phelian and Soumyajit on the big screen.

Queer films are a means of dialogue and emotional expression. So Shibili and I are collaborating to invite you to feel your feelings as we watch these films together. Let’s watch, create, eat and chat! Happy Pride to us all 🏳️‍🌈

name: Kuuk Aah? & Moda Moda - Screening of Two Films
description:
Toto Funds the Arts & Atta Galatta are delighted to invite you to a screening of two short films by M.K. Abhilash, filmmaker, music producer and poet.  Abhilash will be in conversation with Srikanth Srinivasan, film critic and programmer.
About the speakers:
Born on January 5, 1997, MK Abhilash is a filmmaker, music producer, and poet. His film Moda, Moda was shortlisted for the TOTO Award for Short Film 2025, while Kuuk Aah? was longlisted the previous year. He is part of Neelavarana, a Bangalore-based counter-culture collective that showcases Dalit-Bahujan aesthetics and narratives of the region.
Srikanth Srinivasan is a film critic and programmer from Bangalore. His first book, Modernism by Other Means, published by Lightcube in New Delhi in 2021, is devoted to the films of Indian filmmaker Amit Dutta. Dutta is the director of the film Nainsukh (2010), which is the subject of Srikanth's second book, Still Lives, Moving Images, published by Museum Rietberg Zurich in 2023.
We hope to see you there!
performer:
M. K. Abhilash, 
Toto Funds the Arts,

name: Hindustani Classical Vocal Classes - Weekly Classes
description:
Meet Simran, a Hindustani Classical Vocalist and Teacher whose life has been harmoniously entwined with music since childhood. Disciple of Smt. Divya Shenoy, Simran's voice masterfully blends traditional rigor with emotional depth.
For her, music is more than art – it's a sacred, boundless journey of devotion.
With a rich multidisciplinary background in dance, painting, poetry, and theater, her teaching approach is innately creative.
Join her at Atta Galatta every Tuesday, where music transcends melody, becoming a haven to listen, to express and to belong!
Classes will be on every Tuesday – 5 PM for children and 7 PM for adults. The monthly charges will be INR 2000 for one person. Trial classes available at INR 500 per class.

name: Hindustani Classical Vocal Classes - Weekly Classes
description:
Meet Simran, a Hindustani Classical Vocalist and Teacher whose life has been harmoniously entwined with music since childhood. Disciple of Smt. Divya Shenoy, Simran's voice masterfully blends traditional rigor with emotional depth.
For her, music is more than art – it's a sacred, boundless journey of devotion.
With a rich multidisciplinary background in dance, painting, poetry, and theater, her teaching approach is innately creative.
Join her at Atta Galatta every Tuesday, where music transcends melody, becoming a haven to listen, to express and to belong!
Classes will be on every Tuesday – 5 PM for children and 7 PM for adults. The monthly charges will be INR 2000 for one person. Trial classes available at INR 500 per class.

name: Video Games: Lila / Maya - Magazine Launch
description:
Video Games: Lila/Maya explores the rise of video games in India—their aesthetics, narratives, and the concerns of those who make them. It also looks at the interface of video games with theatre and cinema. Games are rapidly changing, and with them the definition of what a game is and what a game can do. From sweatshops which handled the back-end development of western AAA titles, to independent studios and artists that are increasingly embedding their work within the sociocultural and political milieus of the subcontinent—this pioneering volume, brings together the richness of their visual work with critical studies on where we stand in the field of video games in India.
Join Souvik Mukherjee, the Guest Editor of Video Games: Lila/Maya, Padmini Ray Murray, Founder of Design Beku, and Prabhash Tripathy, PhD scholar at JNU, for an insightful conversation on Video Games in India—their past, present and future.

name: Handbuilding Pottery - Experience Workshop
description:
Unleash your creativity and connect with clay in a calming, hands-on session by Maralu Earth!
Join us for a 2-hour immersive workshop where you’ll explore the art of hand-building pottery. Perfect for beginners and hobbyists alike, this session will guide you through the basics of working with clay — from shaping to finishing — in a warm, welcoming space.
Under our guidance, you’ll create your own ceramic pieces to cherish.
Workshop Highlights:
• Create a keepsake miniature and a functional ceramic piece
• Hands-on, personalized instruction throughout
• All materials provided (tools, clay, and more)
• Your creations will be fired and returned (shipping extra if needed)
• Relaxing, mindful environment in the heart of the city
No prior pottery experience needed. Just bring your curiosity and a willingness to get your hands a little muddy!

name: Chapters Unsealed - Book Club
description:
Atta Galatta and Your View on Books cordially invite you to the latest Bibliophile Meetup in town.
Join us for an enriching evening of literary discussion and camaraderie at our Book Club Meet event! Whether you`re a seasoned bibliophile or just discovering the joy of reading, all are welcome to share their insights, opinions, and favorite passages. Engage in lively conversations, exchange recommendations, and bond over our mutual love for literature. Don`t miss out on this opportunity to connect with fellow book enthusiasts and expand your literary horizons!
Bring along your favorite book and delve into a shared reading experience.
What does it entail?
- Involving in an ice breaker extravagant game.
- Sharing your views on favorite books.
- Participating in the curated discussion.
- Discussing a Curated Monthly Book Read.
- Following community guidelines.
Community Guidelines:
- Be open, be civil, be courteous, be kind, and have fun.
- Listen more. Speak mindfully.
- No monopolizing the conversation.
Event Sections:
1. Icebreaker Extravaganza - Intro yourself & let's play an interesting fun Game to break ice cubes.
2. Book Spotlight: This is your time to shine! Take the stage for 5-7 minutes and share your insights, thoughts, and love for any book. No slides required – just bring your passion and captivate your audience.
       INTERMISSION: CHILL & CHAT
3. Monthly Book Discussions - We will discuss about the books that were on vote list in previous CU and also vote for a new book to discuss in the next meet.
4. Awards Galleria - A Surprising session for the participants.
5. Say Butter - Click that Snap button for a group picture.
Disclaimer on Event Coverage:
- Event highlights will be captured through photos and videos for showcasing the event in our social media accounts.
- All Event media will be shared with the participants upon request.

name: 50 Above Fifty – India’s Biggest Senior Talent Event - Talent Hunt
description:
🪩 LIVE Auditions in Bengaluru! 🎶
 
Are you 50+ and ready to showcase your talent? Your stage awaits! 🌟
Step into the spotlight and take your first step towards becoming India's Senior Superstar at Khyaal’s 50 Above 50 – India’s biggest talent hunt for seniors!
📍 Venue: Atta Galatta, Bengaluru
🎭 Choose your category — Singing, Dancing, Poetry, Art, Storytelling, Comedy & more!
🎁 Stand a chance to win exciting cash prizes
💰 Registration Fee: ₹999 only
🎉 Exclusive Benefits for Participants:
✅ Nominate yourself in 2 or more award categories
✅ Get 1-year FREE membership to the Khyaal Club — India’s largest club for seniors!
📲 Register now and let your talent shine: https://forms.gle/Pi8gwH4es8uN56nFA
💻 Pay online at www.50above50.com or at the venue.
🔗 For more details about the different categories, visit: https://www.50above50.com/categories

name: Crisp Creation - Cooking Workshop for Kids
description:
This workshop titled, “Crisp Creations” connects children to fireless cooking and to bring not just their hands, but their hearts and art to healthy eating while they whip up delicacies interestingly. It is a two-hour engagement that aims at building a relationship with Conscious food and its consumption.
This workshop helps children who face the challenge of balancing nutrition with taste - which is often the only thing children care about! It aims at helping children to be more informed & connected to what they eat. The workshop shares the authors experience in creating delicious menus & even snacks which children gobble up.
Passionate about creating tasty and healthy food, Santhilakshmy's journey started 25 years ago taking her to schools & educational forums as an advocate of tasty & nutritious meals, making a case for understanding our food better. Her background as a science teacher, parent & enthusiastic chef helps lend credibility to the meals she whips up. Testimony to this commitment is the sustainable & organic kitchens she created at some Schools in Bangalore.
Santhilakshmy has been communicating on topics such as Millets in Your Daily Meals, Holistic Nutrition and Conscious Kitchen. Through her work, Santhilakshmy actively campaigns for our need to return focus to our habits, myths & fads, tradition, flavours & sustainability of culinary practices in India. She recently authored the book “Windows to Mindful Eating” that carefully combines these thoughts in words and coloured illustrations to stimulate the minds of adults and children alike.

name: Celebrate World Localization Day! - Film Screening
description:
In celebration of World Localization Day, foodwize invites you to a special screening of Planet Local: A Quiet Revolution. This powerful film highlights community-led solutions, featuring voices like Jane Goodall, Noam Chomsky and Naomi Klein. It’s a tribute to the quiet revolution happening worldwide through local food, economies and resilience. Stay back after the film for an open space to reflect and share stories.
Trailer: https://youtu.be/3VKoisJfADM?si=Ycuh-tgdu5SYBtqm

name: 50 Above Fifty – India’s Biggest Senior Talent Event - Talent Hunt
description:
🪩 LIVE Auditions in Bengaluru! 🎶
 
Are you 50+ and ready to showcase your talent? Your stage awaits! 🌟
Step into the spotlight and take your first step towards becoming India's Senior Superstar at Khyaal’s 50 Above 50 – India’s biggest talent hunt for seniors!
📍 Venue: Atta Galatta, Bengaluru

💻 Pay online at www.50above50.com or at the venue.
🔗 For more details about the different categories, visit: https://www.50above50.com/categories

name: Mahabharata Magic: Draw Your Imagination! - A Mythology-Inspired Drawing Competition for Kids
description:
🎨 "Mahabharata Magic: Draw Your Imagination!" 🌟
A Mythology-Inspired Drawing Competition for Kids!
Join us for a delightful day where stories come alive and little hands bring epic tales to paper! ✨
📚 Hosted by Ankita Aggarwal, author of children's book Mahabharata - Stories of Valor and Virtue, this unique event will begin with a short, engaging storytelling session from her book — retelling the grand Indian epic in a way that's fun, friendly, and perfect for young minds.
🖍️ After the story, kids will get to draw scenes, characters, or anything inspired by the world of Mahabharata!
🎨 Age Categories:
Tiny Artists (3–5 years)
Young Creators (6–8 years)
Junior Illustrators (8+ years)
🏆 Exciting prizes, lots of creativity, and a mythological adventure await!
📍Atta Galatta, Indiranagar
📋 Bring your own arts and crafts materials!
Choose from the following time slots - 11 AM, 2 PM or 4 PM - and let your child’s imagination meet India’s greatest epic!

name: Pebble Painting - Painting Workshop
description:
Get ready for a colorful Sunday morning filled with creativity and joy! Join us for a Pebble Painting Workshop designed especially for kids aged 6 to 14 years.
Held at the warm and welcoming Atta Galatta, Bangalore, this hands-on session will take place on Sunday, 29th June, at 11 AM. Kids will explore their creativity by transforming simple pebbles into vibrant works of art. Guided by a passionate art instructor, the workshop encourages self-expression, fine motor skill development, and lots of fun!
Whether your child loves doodling or is just discovering the joys of art, this workshop is the perfect weekend activity. All materials will be provided, and each little artist will take home their painted pebble masterpieces.
Come join us and let your child experience the joy of painting, storytelling, and making art they can proudly display or gift!

name: Screen Craft - Screenplay Writing Workshop
description:
Atta Galatta and MWM MOVIES cordially invite you to the latest Screenplay Writing Workshop in town. 
Our Screenplay Writing workshop is an intensive program designed to guide aspiring screenwriters through the process of crafting compelling and marketable screenplays. This workshop provides participants with a solid foundation in screenplay structure, character development, dialogue writing, and industry-standard formatting, ensuring they are equipped to bring their stories to life on the big screen.
Who Should Attend?
This workshop is ideal for beginners with little to no screenwriting experience, as well as intermediate writers looking to refine their skills. It is also suitable for novelists, playwrights, or anyone interested in exploring the craft of screenwriting.
Workshop Objectives:
- To introduce participants to the fundamentals of screenplay writing.
- To develop participants` skills in creating engaging plots and well-rounded characters.
- To enhance participants` abilities to write effective dialogue and visual storytelling.
- To familiarize participants with the screenplay industry and submission processes.
Key Components involves learning theory and practicals of: 
- Story and Character Development
- Screenplay Structure
- Dialogue Writing
- Scene Construction
- Visual Storytelling
- Formatting and Style
What does it entail:
- Involving in an ice breaker extravagant game.
- Writing a story based on a prompt.
- Participating in the curated feedback discussion.
- Following community guidelines.
Community Guidelines:
- Be open, be civil, be courteous, be kind, and have fun.
- Listen more. Speak mindfully.
- No monopolizing the conversation.
Disclaimer on Event Coverage:
- Event highlights will be captured through photos and videos for showcasing the event in our social media accounts.
- All Event media will be shared with the participants upon request.

name: Explore the Magic of Paper Quilling! - Paper Quilling Workshop
description:
Join us for a fun and creative Underwater Paper Quilling Workshop at Atta Galatta, Bangalore, on Sunday, 29th June at 5:00 PM! Designed especially for children aged 8 and above, this hands-on session introduces the beautiful art of paper quilling in a fun, beginner-friendly way.
Participants will learn to roll, shape, and arrange colorful paper strips to create an enchanting underwater scene filled with fish, turtles, seaweed, and more! The background painting will be premade, so kids can focus solely on the exciting process of quilling and assembling their aquatic artwork.
No prior experience is needed — just bring your creativity and curiosity! All materials will be provided, and each child will go home with their very own framed quilled masterpiece.
Whether your child is an art lover or just looking to try something new, this workshop promises a relaxed, engaging, and imaginative evening. Limited seats available — book now and let the creativity flow!

name: Reincarnations - Improv Show
description: Prana, Energy, Life Force - every culture has a different name for it, but we all intuitively know what it is: the essence that makes up everything around us. Isn’t it fascinating that we’re all made up of the same stuff, yet each form looks so different? Inspired by the narrative storytelling technique of Indian epics, seemingly unrelated stories will weave in and out of each other, forming a wonderful tapestry of intertwined stories. After successful runs in Berlin, Stockholm and Hanoi, Improv Lore is pleased to bring its signature show “Reincarnations” to Bengaluru! Completely unscripted, this show promises the audience unexpected twists, a glimpse into other worlds and a reminder that every ending is just another beginning.

name: Hindustani Classical Vocal Classes - Weekly Classes
description:
Meet Simran, a Hindustani Classical Vocalist and Teacher whose life has been harmoniously entwined with music since childhood. Disciple of Smt. Divya Shenoy, Simran's voice masterfully blends traditional rigor with emotional depth.
For her, music is more than art – it's a sacred, boundless journey of devotion.
With a rich multidisciplinary background in dance, painting, poetry, and theater, her teaching approach is innately creative.
Join her at Atta Galatta every Tuesday, where music transcends melody, becoming a haven to listen, to express and to belong!
Classes will be on every Tuesday – 5 PM for children and 7 PM for adults. The monthly charges will be INR 2000 for one person. Trial classes available at INR 500 per class.

name: The BWW Short Story Community - Literary Meetup
description:
The BWW Short Story Community
This month we will discuss Cat Person by Kristen Roupenian 
What this is:
This is a ticketed, curated literary and community event, presented by Bhumika Anand from the Bangalore Writers Workshop, where we will do a deep-dive analysis and discussion of a short story.
You get to join a reading community where you will get to read a pre-chosen short story a month.
You get to examine the story in terms of its literary merit, yes, but also in terms of writing craft and context, which will be very useful if you are an aspiring storyteller or writer.
Who should join:
If you are above 18 years old, interested in storytelling, literature, or are an aspiring or published author, this is for you.
If you are new in the city and want to be part of a community and make friends over writing,storytelling, and literature, then this is for you.
What does it entail:
Reading the prescribed story.
Participating in the curated discussion.
Following community guidelines.
Community Guidelines:
Be open, be civil, be courteous, be kind, and have fun.
Listen more. Speak mindfully.
No monopolising the conversation.

name: Creative Jam - Bangalore Edition - Offline Jam
description:
An offline jam for people who want to create, express, and connect —outside of their 9 to 5.
Expect 2 hours of:

Fun intros with strangers
Open mic for your hidden talents
Quick creative challenges
Promises to self
Real conversations (not networking)
Exciting goodies

No big talks. No panels.
Just people like you—figuring things out.
📍 Atta Galatta, Bangalore
📅 6th July
DM 9779618662 for tickets.

name: Hindustani Classical Vocal Classes - Weekly Classes
description:
Meet Simran, a Hindustani Classical Vocalist and Teacher whose life has been harmoniously entwined with music since childhood. Disciple of Smt. Divya Shenoy, Simran's voice masterfully blends traditional rigor with emotional depth.
For her, music is more than art – it's a sacred, boundless journey of devotion.
With a rich multidisciplinary background in dance, painting, poetry, and theater, her teaching approach is innately creative.
Join her at Atta Galatta every Tuesday, where music transcends melody, becoming a haven to listen, to express and to belong!
Classes will be on every Tuesday – 5 PM for children and 7 PM for adults. The monthly charges will be INR 2000 for one person. Trial classes available at INR 500 per class.

name: Misled Towards Truth - Book Launch
description:
Crime Thriller Author Rakhi Haridas to Introduce New Book MISLED Towards TRUTH at Atta Galatta, Bangalore
Lovers of mystery, thrillers, and powerful storytelling are in for an exciting evening as acclaimed author and leadership coach Rakhi Haridas unveils her latest crime thriller, MISLED Towards TRUTH. The book introduction and author conversation event will take place on 12th July, 2025, from 4 PM to 5 PM IST at the iconic literary hub Atta Galatta, Indiranagar, Bangalore.
This one-hour literary gathering promises not just a book launch, but a deep and intimate conversation with the author about the creative journey, writing process, and mysteries behind the mystery.

name: Deevara Chittara - Book Launch
description: Center for Revival of Indigenous Art (CFRIA) a Bengaluru non-profit presents its seminal work on Chittara: 'Deevara Chittara: the artform, the people, their culture', a significant milestone in the documentation and celebration of this indigenous folk art from Karnataka. The book brings out the essence of Malenad region's rich cultural heritage, of which Chittara is an integral part. Join us for the launch of this meticulously crafted coffee table book (Co-authors Geetha Bhat and Smitha Tumuluru, with photography by Smitha Tumuluru and publication design and illustrations by Namrata Cavale). Engage with artists from the Deevaru community and gain insights into their cultural practices. Witness a Deevaru artist use a natural fibre brush and bring a Chittara painting to life, to the accompaniment of live singing, and join in thought provoking conversations around artists, remuneration, eco-friendly crafts, the role of women and the future of art.
performer: Center for Revival of Indigenous Art

name: Let's Talk About Attraction and Relationships - Wellness Workshop
description:
As we evolved, humans became heavily dependent on each other for well being, survival and safety. Communal living helped individuals experience safety, belongingness and pride over painful experiences of fear, loneliness and shame. Among the many interpersonal developments consequent to communal living was the complex decision making of selecting a mating partner or a long-term romantic partner. The workshop attempts to delineate the factors involved in an individual decision making process pertaining to finding a partner and how those factors play out once the relationship begins to unfold.
What can you expect from the workshop?
A discussion on how gender roles have changed and gender specific expectations have changed over the years
Defining one’s value
Discussion on how one perceives one value/ and relevance to be in the context of society and family
Discussion on value acquired in family of origin (attachment-based value)
Discussion on value acquired among peers/society/communities based on attributes like intellect, physical looks, social status, financial resources
Dynamic interaction between these two different systems of value.
Do we tend to enhance our value through associating with a certain partner and if so how much does that play into attraction?
What is power and control in a relationship
How much does unresolved memories contribute to our concept of value
Introducing the concept of exile and critical self
Why do we tend to seek affection from those who have hurt us?
Deeper discussion in to Anatomy of shame and how much it contributes to attraction
Regular refreshments will be provided.
The workshop is organised by Dr Mathai Fenn, Dr Nimesh George And Dr Gokul Ratakonda, all of whom are practising psychotherapists and psychologists.
performer:
Gokul R. , 
Mathai Fenn, 
Nimesh George,

name: Journaling Workshop - Slow Journaling Workshop
description:
Best friending journaling – a slow workshop to meet your journal like a true friend!
Join us for a gentle, expressive 2-hour journaling workshop designed for anyone looking to slow down, reflect, and reconnect with themselves and others. This isn’t about writing neatly or every day. It’s about using art, words, scraps, sketches, and stories to find meaning in the mess.
Whether you’re a fresh-in-the-city soul, a quiet creator, or simply someone rebuilding after a life shift, this space is for you.
We’ll explore creative prompts, memory-based journaling, and playful scrapbooking techniques to help you best-friend your journal, one page at a time.
🗓 Date: Sunday, 20th July 2024
🕑 Time: 2:30 p.m. to 4:30 p.m.
📍 venue: Attata Galatta, Bengaluru
💸 Ticket: ₹299 (includes a cup of filter coffee ☕)
🧺 Bring: your journal, small keepsakes or scraps, memories and a curious heart
No journaling experience needed—just come as you are.

name: Make the Second Half Count - A Mid-Year Review Workshop
description:
A Mid-Year Check-In Workshop using the Work-Life Planner Journal.
📖🖊️ For anyone who wants to pause, reflect and reset — personally and professionally.
Wait, how is it July already?
The to-do lists, Zoom calls, life updates, overthinking spirals… and now suddenly half the year is gone?
Whether you`re feeling proud, stuck, burnt out, or just confused — this workshop is your moment to pause and check in with yourself.
This isn’t just about goals.
It’s about how you felt doing all of it. What mattered. What didn’t. And what you want the rest of the year to feel like — in your work, life, energy, and self.
Join us for a guided 75-minute session that blends reflection, journaling, and realignment — using the Work-Life Planner Journal to help you reset with clarity (and a little gentleness).
💬 In this workshop, you will:
✅ Reflect on what’s worked and what hasn’t in the first half of 2025
✅ Use powerful prompts from the Work-Life Planner Journal to assess where your energy has gone
✅ Set meaningful personal and work goals for the second half of the year
✅ Redefine “success” on your terms (not what Instagram told you)
You’ll laugh, you might cry, and most importantly — you’ll leave feeling lighter and clearer.
No pressure. Just presence.
Come as you are. No journaling experience needed.
🪑 Limited seats only (15 max)
🎟️ INR 350 & INR 250 (early bird offer)  
📍 Atta Galatta, Bangalore
📔 Journal sheets + pens provided
